abstracts.cdata!:
The Rio Flood Reconstruction and
            Prevention Project, to be implemented over a two-year
            period, consists of both reconstruction and preventative
            activities.  The reconstruction activities consist of
            rehabilitation and repair of infrastructure damaged by the
            floods and accompanying landslides, while the preventative
            activities are designed to minimize damage otherwise likely
            to occur during any future major rains.  The project
            consists of the following components:  (a) repair of roads
            and bridges; (b) repairs and dredging of drainage systems;
            and (c) terracing, buttressing, retaining walls, and other
            structural stabilization of steep hillsides.  It also
            includes (d) repairs of sewerage systems, and essential
            extension of sewerage networks; (e) improved collection and
            disposal of solid wastes; (f) reforestation of steep
            hillsides most likely to slide; and (g) provision of
            minimally serviced sites for families whose homes were
            destroyed during the floods or landslides and for families
            needing to be resettled. Finally, the project involves (h)
            repairs and rehabilitation of public buildings; (i) purchase
            of imported rescue and salvage equipment; (j)
            consultants' services and technical assistance; and
            project administration.
